title: Valles Caldera National Preserve: Rules & Regulations
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Rules & Regulations              Rules & Regulations       The following rules and regulations have been sorted by subject for your convenience. This section does not attempt to duplicate the Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) so it should not be regarded as a comprehensive list of regulations. It will, however, answer many of the most common questions regarding preserve rules. The Superintendent's Compendium (PDF, 3.4 MB) is a listing of local regulations that is more technical and comprehensive concerning local issues.   Information EVERY Visitor Needs to Know!     Pets   Fishing   Horseback Riding   Mountain Biking   Required Permits   Backcountry Access  (includes vehicle permit information)        Firearms in Preserve As of February 22, 2010, a new federal law allows people who can legally possess firearms under applicable federal, state, and local laws, to legally possess firearms in this preserve.  It is the responsibility of visitors to understand and comply with all applicable state, local, and federal firearms laws before entering this park. As a starting point, please visit our state’s website.   Federal law prohibits firearms in certain facilities in this preserve (such as visitor center, government offices, etc.).
